annotation.text: Conversely, reducing Rpt6 or Rpt4 levels decreased the number of inclusions in primary neurons, indicating that endogenous Rpt4 and Rpt6 facilitate inclusion formation.

annotation.infon: positive regulation of inclusion body assembly|GO:0090261
annotation.text: We found that reducing the levels of Rpt6 or Rpt4 substantially reduced the number of cells containing poly(Q) inclusions when we examined cells expressing mutant Htt together with siRNA targeted against Rpt6 or Rpt4

annotation.infon: positive regulation of inclusion body assembly|GO:0090261
annotation.text: This analysis demonstrates that reducing the levels of Rpt4 or Rpt6 in primary neurons significantly decrease inclusion formation.
